data.title: Barrow, Arthur Robert MacLean (1866-1953)
data.meta_description: Arthur Robert Maclean Barrow, sketch by his niece, Phyllis Mackeish, British Columbia Archives, photograph 36472, reproduced in John A. Whittaker, Early Land Surveyors of British Columbia, 1990, Corporation of Land Surveyors of British Columbia, page 9. A R Barrow signature - Survey plan of Se-As-Bunkut Indian Reservation Number 2 - 1912; http://www.lac-bac.gc.ca/databases/indian-reserves/001004-119.02-e.php?&isn_id_nbr=211&interval=50&page_sequence_nbr=1&&PHPSESSID=o3cqkqv2g25jr1lbbqd2ete2d7 Arthur Robert MacLean…
data.text:
Arthur Robert MacLean Barrow was a surveyor and civil engineer.

He lived at 2061 Beach Avenue in 1905.

Family Background

Arthur Robert MacLean Barrow was born in London, England on April 3, 1866. His parents were Alexander MacLean Barrow (born about 1832) and Sarah Constance Mallett (born about 1839).

In 1881, Alexander Barrow was a retired merchant who was living in Caterham.

Arthur’s grandfather was Thomas Culliford Barrow (1793-1857), who was a clerk in the British Navy pay office. Thomas’s sister, Elizabeth Barrow, married John Dickens in 1809, and was the mother of Charles Dickens, the English novelist.

Early Life

Arthur attended Radley College in Oxfordshire from 1879 to 1882. He studied mechanical engineering.

In 1889, he appeared in the list of graduates in the Proceedings of the Institute of Mechanical Engineers.

To India

By 1892, Arthur was living in India, where he worked with the locomotive department of the North Western Railway in Sukkur.

Marriage to Elizabeth Houghton

On November 16, 1892, in Karachi, Arthur married Elizabeth Alexandra Houghton. Elizabeth’s father was John Samuel Houghton (1840-1872), who had been a railway refreshment room contractor. (In the 1881 census of England, Elizabeth A. Houghton was the step-daughter of James Bradford. Elizabeth’s birthplace was Bradford in Yorkshire.)

To British Columbia

Arthur and his family arrived in British Columbia in 1896. In 1897, they were living in the City of Nelson.

Elizabeth died in Nelson on June 16, 1897.

Marriage to Daisy Houghton

In 1898, in Calgary, Northwest Territories, Arthur married Daisy Illman Houghton, who was Elizabeth Houghton’s sister. Daisy was born on January 21, 1872, in Brighton, Sussex, England and she was christened in Brighton on February 14, 1872. Daisy’s parents were John Samuel Houghton and Emma Jane Houghton.

Career in British Columbia

Arthur became a BC land surveyor in 1899.

In 1902, he appeared in the list of graduates from the Institute of Mechanical Engineers. His address was in Nelson, British Columbia.

In 1902, Arthur auctioned his furniture and household effects as he got ready to move away from Nelson.

In 1903, Arthur was living on Hill Island in the Gulf Islands, along with his brother, Francis John Barrow (1876-1944).

From 1907 to 1910, Arthur was surveying the townsite for Prince Rupert, which was the Pacific terminus of the Grand Trunk Pacific Railway.

In 1910, he was elected as an alderman in Prince Rupert’s first city council.

Military Service

During the First World War, Arthur served with the 30th Railway Battalion, Royal Engineers. He returned from the war in early 1919.

Later, the family lived in Smithers, Johnson Landing in the Kootenays, and Pouce Coupe, in the Peace River District.

Daisy: Death in Victoria

Daisy died in Victoria, British Columbia, on November 27, 1921. She was buried in Ross Bay Cemetery in Victoria.

Arthur: Later Life

Arthur retired in the 1930s.

He died in Victoria on March 8, 1953.

Children

Lucy Constance Barrow

Arthur Robert MacLean Barrow and Elizabeth Alexandra Houghton had one daughter. She was Lucy Constance Barrow, who was born on November 11, 1893, in Rajahmundry, Madras, India.

Lucy was living in Vancouver in 1901.

She died in England on June 30, 1915.

Elizabeth Barrow

Arthur Robert MacLean Barrow and Daisy Illman Houghton had one daughter. She was Elizabeth Barrow, who was born in Nelson, British Columbia on December 28, 1900.

On August 25, 1923, Elizabeth married Gordon James Reading in Prince Rupert, British Columbia. Gordon was a civil service clerk, who was born in Chiswick, Middlesex, England on May 16, 1889. His parents were James Reading and Elizabeth Reynolds.

On October 27, 1924, Gordon travelled to the United States.

On November 24, 1924, Elizabeth and her son, Rodney, travelled to the United States.

In 1930 and 1940, Gordon and Elizabeth were living in Seattle, Washington, along with their son, Rodney.

In 1944, Gordon applied to become a naturalized United States citizen.

Gordon died in Seattle, Washington on June 9, 1961.

Further information on Elizabeth is not available.

Gordon and Elizabeth had a son, Rodney Maclean Reading, who was born in Prince Rupert, British Columbia, on August 1, 1924.

He moved to the United States with his parents in 1924.

On December 23, 1950, in Seattle, he married Gloria Sutton. She was born in Seattle on November 22, 1926.

Rodney died in King County, Washington on May 8, 1991.

Gloria died in Everett, Washington on Ocober 25, 2009.

Sources

Barrow Family
